remarks: Composition of two functions.  Variation of ~ fmptco when the second function has two arguments.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2015.)
statement:
fmpt2co.1 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. A /\ y e. B ) ) -> R e. C ) $.
fmpt2co.2 $e |- ( ph -> F = ( x e. A , y e. B |-> R ) ) $.
fmpt2co.3 $e |- ( ph -> G = ( z e. C |-> S ) ) $.
fmpt2co.4 $e |- ( z = R -> S = T ) $.
fmpt2co $p |- ( ph -> ( G o. F ) = ( x e. A , y e. B |-> T ) ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d B x y $.
$d C x y z $.
$d R z $.
$d S x y $.
$d T z $.
$d ph x y $.
